Name: DVIR Form: Forklift - Extended Compliance with Maintenance
Description: Comprehensive Driver Vehicle Inspection Report for forklifts with extended compliance checks and preventive maintenance items

Items.Name: Frame and Body (cracks, dents, damage)
Items.Comment: Inspect main frame for structural integrity

Items.Name: Tires or Tracks (condition, wear, cuts)
Items.Comment: Check for proper inflation and damage

Items.Name: Headlights and Taillights (both functioning)
Items.Comment: Test all lights, check for broken lenses

Items.Name: Warning Lights (beacon/strobe operational)
Items.Comment: Verify warning light function if equipped

Items.Name: Horn (audible and functioning)
Items.Comment: Test horn operation

Items.Name: Mirrors (condition and visibility)
Items.Comment: Inspect if equipped, ensure proper angles

Items.Name: Overhead Guard (intact, no damage)
Items.Comment: Verify guard is present and properly fastened

Items.Name: Safety Decals and Markings (visible, legible)
Items.Comment: Capacity plates and warning labels readable

Items.Name: Leaks Under Vehicle (hydraulic, fuel, coolant)
Items.Comment: Inspect undercarriage for fluid seepage

Items.Name: Undercarriage Condition (no bent components)
Items.Comment: Check for damage from impacts

Items.Name: Tire Pressure (within specification)
Items.Comment: Measure PSI if pneumatic tires equipped

Items.Name: Seat Condition (secure, no rips or damage)
Items.Comment: Inspect cushion and mounting bolts

Items.Name: Seat Belt (present and functional)
Items.Comment: Test belt operation and retraction

Items.Name: Steering (smooth, centered, no play)
Items.Comment: Test steering wheel and response

Items.Name: Brake Pedal (firm, responsive, no sponginess)
Items.Comment: Test foot brake operation and feel

Items.Name: Parking Brake (holds when engaged)
Items.Comment: Verify parking brake holds vehicle stationary

Items.Name: Control Levers (smooth operation, no sticking)
Items.Comment: Test all hydraulic control lever movements

Items.Name: Emergency Stop Button (accessible and functional)
Items.Comment: Verify emergency stop button operation

Items.Name: Engine Oil Level (proper level)
Items.Comment: Check dipstick or gauge reading

Items.Name: Coolant Level (within specification)
Items.Comment: Inspect expansion tank or radiator level

Items.Name: Battery Condition (terminals clean, charge indicator)
Items.Comment: For electric forklifts - check battery status

Items.Name: Battery Water Level (if applicable)
Items.Comment: For lead-acid batteries - check water level

Items.Name: Fuel Level (adequate for operation)
Items.Comment: For gasoline/diesel models

Items.Name: Belts and Hoses (no cracks, fraying, or leaks)
Items.Comment: Inspect engine belt and cooling hoses

Items.Name: Engine Starting and Idle (smooth, no unusual sounds)
Items.Comment: Test engine startup and idle operation

Items.Name: Mast Operation (smooth, no binding, vertical alignment)
Items.Comment: Raise and lower mast, check for smooth travel

Items.Name: Mast Straightness (no visible bends or twists)
Items.Comment: Visually inspect mast for damage

Items.Name: Forks (no cracks, bends, or excessive wear)
Items.Comment: Inspect fork tips and engagement areas

Items.Name: Load Backrest Bar (no cracks, properly fastened)
Items.Comment: Verify backrest attachment and condition

Items.Name: Tilt Mechanism (forward/backward tilt responsive)
Items.Comment: Test mast tilt - should respond to control input

Items.Name: Side Shift Capability (if equipped, responsive)
Items.Comment: Test side shift mechanism operation

Items.Name: Hydraulic Cylinders (no leaks, rod undamaged)
Items.Comment: Inspect lift and tilt cylinders for damage

Items.Name: Hydraulic Hoses (no cracks, fraying, or leaks)
Items.Comment: Check all hose connections and routing

Items.Name: Hydraulic Fluid Level (within specification)
Items.Comment: Check sight glass or dipstick

Items.Name: Hydraulic Fluid Condition (check color and clarity)
Items.Comment: Look for contamination or dark discoloration

Items.Name: Preventive Maintenance: Oil Change Due
Items.Comment: Check if scheduled maintenance is due

Items.Name: Preventive Maintenance: Filter Inspection (oil, fuel)
Items.Comment: Visually inspect filters if accessible

Items.Name: Preventive Maintenance: Lubrication Points
Items.Comment: Check if grease points need lubrication

Items.Name: Preventive Maintenance: Leak Inspection (all systems)
Items.Comment: Complete visual inspection under vehicle

Items.Name: Preventive Maintenance: Belt and Hose Age Assessment
Items.Comment: Note any cracking or deterioration

Items.Name: Preventive Maintenance: Battery Terminals (corrosion, cleanliness)
Items.Comment: Check for white/blue corrosion buildup

Items.Name: Preventive Maintenance: Tire Tread Depth (if applicable)
Items.Comment: Use penny test or tread depth gauge

Items.Name: Preventive Maintenance: Unusual Noises or Vibrations
Items.Comment: Report any new/different sounds during operation

Items.Name: Preventive Maintenance: Body Condition (rust, damage)
Items.Comment: Note any new rust spots or cosmetic damage

Items.Name: Driver Comments
Items.Comment: Record any issues found, maintenance needs, or operational concerns
